title: please help me figure out the name of this font...
content:
please help me figure out the name of this font...The script is Chopin Script. But what is the one that is in all caps? Check out the capital e. It’s like a lowercase e. It’s pretty, right? but what is the font called?? Thanks!!!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/classic1-1_4203.jpg)

 [‹ 50% discount on all DSTYPE faces through August 14](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35581 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can anyone suggest an alternative to Rockwell ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35606 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jesslipton

comments.content: Sorry, that’s the best image I have.

It is a unicase font. Can you post a close-up?

Nick Shinn has one, Panoptica:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/panoptica/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/panoptica/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/panoptica/")

And there is a famous one at P22:  
 [http://www.p22.com/lanston/products/bodoni\_26.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630/http:/www.p22.com/lanston/products/bodoni_26.html "http://www.p22.com/lanston/products/bodoni\_26.html")

Oh well, could it be one of those?

There are some unicase threads you can peruse for more names:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/6699](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6699 "http://www.typophile.com/node/6699")

[http://www.typophile.com/node/18746](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18746 "http://www.typophile.com/node/18746")

Jftr, Bodoni 26 was named by some group of hurrumphs as one of the top 100 typefaces of all time.
The script’s true name is Polonaisse designed by Phil Martin of Alphabest Inovations. But the copying of the font and changing the name is a common practice.
Filosofia Unicase Regular. To me it looks like the caps in the photo are just resized. There isn’t a small caps version done in unicase to my knowledge.

_To me it looks like the caps in the photo are just resized._

Well, it could be [**Paul Baker’s digital version**](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630/http:/www.pbtweb.com/alpha26/alpha.htm) of [**Bradbury Thompson’s Alphabet 26**](http://web.archive.org/web/20071201213630/http:/www.aiga.org/content.cfm/bradbury-thompson-alphabet-26)... Baker’s version uses an uppercase **G** , like in the invitation (Thompson’s had a lowercase **g** ), and has a set of caps.

Then again, fontplayer has already posted a link to Bodoni 26, which is another version of the same face, and it, too, has a set of caps (and an uppercase **G** ).

One more thing, this thread belongs in the Type ID Board. :-)

<cite>Jftr, Bodoni 26 was named by some group of hurrumphs...</cite>

Btw, If any typophile member is one of the “hurrumphs”, I hope you do not take offense at my flippant generalization. In retrospect, anyone voting for that font can’t be too terribly hurrumphish.  
; )
Thank you so much!!! Wow, this is my first time coming to this forum. This is so cool!!! thanks!!!
